a machine readable transcription

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: As we go around
bibl.orgName: The Walt Whitman Collection, Harry Ransom Humanities Research Center, The University of Texas at Austin
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

body.p: As we go around, day and night, to some one or other of these huge Military Hospitals, (they are not to be counted by ones and twos, but by dozens.)—as we pass down these long wards, with hat for the first time taken involuntarily and reverently off, with from an effect upon us of humility that all the Presidents, princes, Congresses, and Generals of the world would never begin to produce, we find each and every one of the middle, eastern and western States plentifully represented. New York and Pennsylvania have their offspring here by hundreds, by thousands. Ohio and Illinois and Indiana and Michigan, are here. Massachusetts and Maine and all the New England States are here
